Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Modify firmware environment values" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Perform volume maintenance tasks user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right can manage volume and disk configurations. They could potentially delete volumes, resulting in, data loss or a DoS.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Perform volume maintenance tasks" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Profile single process user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Profile single process" user right can monitor non-system processes performance. An attacker could potentially use this to identify processes to attack.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Profile single process" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Profile system performance user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Profile system performance" user right can monitor system processes performance. An attacker could potentially use this to identify processes to attack.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Profile system performance" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators NT Service\WdiServiceHost

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Replace a process level token user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Replace a process level token" user right allows one process or service to start another process or service with a different security access token. A user with this right could use this to impersonate another account.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>true</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Replace a process level token" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Local Service Network Service

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Restore files and directories user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Restore files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data. It could also be used to over-write more current data.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>true</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><Responsibility>Information Assurance Officer</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Restore files and directories" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Take ownership of files or other objects

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Take ownership of files or other objects user right.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Take ownership of files or other objects" user right can take ownership of objects and make changes.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Take ownership of files or other objects" to only include the following accounts or groups:
Administrators

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Account Logon -> Credential Validation" successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> Account Logon -> "Audit Credential Validation" with Success selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Account Logon -> Credential Validation" failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Detailed auditing subcategories are configured in Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration. The summary level settings under Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Audit Policy will not be enforced (see V-14230).
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> Account Logon -> "Audit Credential Validation" with Failure selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Account Management -> Computer Account Management" successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Computer Account Management records events such as the creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling computer accounts. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Computer Account Management" with "Success" selected.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Account Management -> Computer Account Management" failures.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Computer Account Management records events such as the creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling computer accounts. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Account Management -> Other Account Management Events" successes.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Other Account Management records events such as the access of a password hash or the Password Policy Checking API being called. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The system will be configured to audit "Logon/Logoff -> Logoff" successes.

<VulnDiscussion>Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred as well as detecting attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The 6to4 IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>IPv6 transition technologies which tunnel packets through other protocols do not provide visibility.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> TCPIP Settings -> IPv6 Transition Technologies -> 6to4 State to Enabled: Disabled State.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The IP-HTTPS IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>IPv6 transition technologies which tunnel packets through other protocols do not provide visibility.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> TCPIP Settings -> IPv6 Transition Technologies -> IP-HTTPS State to Enabled: Disabled State.
Note: "IPHTTPS URL:" must be entered in policy even if set to Disabled State, enter about:blank.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The ISATAP IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>IPv6 transition technologies which tunnel packets through other protocols do not provide visibility.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> TCPIP Settings -> IPv6 Transition Technologies -> ISATAP State to Enabled: Disabled State.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Teredo IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>IPv6 transition technologies which tunnel packets through other protocols do not provide visibility.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> TCPIP Settings -> IPv6 Transition Technologies -> Teredo State to Enabled: Disabled State.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Application event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> Application -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Security event log size must be configured to 196608 KB or greater.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Security >> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "196608" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Setup event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> Setup -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The System event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO. Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Event Log Service -> System -> "Maximum Log Size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the DoD Root CA certificates. DoD Root CA 2 DoD Root CA 3 DoD Root CA 4
The InstallRoot tool is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The External Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store on unclassified systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure secure websites protected with External Certificate Authority (ECA) server certificates are properly validated, the system must trust the ECA Root CAs. The ECA root certificates will ensure the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the External CAs. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the ECA Root CA certificates on unclassified systems. ECA Root CA 2 ECA Root CA 4
The InstallRoot tool is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.
Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint DoD Root CA 2 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 1 - 22BBE981F0694D246CC1472ED2B021DC8540A22F DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FFAD03329B9E527A43EEC66A56F9CBB5393E6E13 DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - FCE1B1E25374DD94F5935BEB86CA643D8C8D1FF4
Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.
The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: WINRG-000001 Active Setup\Installed Components Registry Permissions

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values. If standard user accounts have this capability there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Maintain the default permissions of the following registry keys: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components\ HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components\ (64-bit systems only)
Users - Read Administrators - Full Control SYSTEM - Full Control CREATOR OWNER - Special (Special = Full Control - Subkeys only)

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Always Install with Elevated Privileges Disabled

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges must be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges. Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> "Always install with elevated privileges" to "Disabled".

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Local admin accounts filtered token policy enabled on domain systems.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>A compromised local administrator account can provide means for an attacker to move laterally between domain systems.
With User Account Control enabled, filtering the privileged token for local administrator accounts will prevent the elevated privileges of these accounts from being used over the network.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Apply UAC restrictions to local accounts on network logons" to "Enabled".
This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) must be enabled and configured to Application Opt In.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> "System ASLR" to "Enabled" with "Application Opt-In" selected.
The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Default Protections for Internet Explorer must be enabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> EMET >> "Default Protections for Internet Explorer" to "Enabled".
Note: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.
Due to a change in the registry structure for EMET 5.5, if the system has a previous version of EMET installed and configured, this setting needs to be set to "Not Configured" prior to the upgrade to EMET 5.5, and the new administrative template files copied to the appropriate area. The setting can then be re-enabled.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Default Protections for Recommended Software must be enabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> EMET >> "Default Protections for Recommended Software" to "Enabled".
Note: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.
Due to a change in the registry structure for EMET 5.5, if the system has a previous version of EMET installed and configured, this setting needs to be set to "Not Configured" prior to the upgrade to EMET 5.5, and the new administrative template files copied to the appropriate area. The setting can then be re-enabled.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Default Protections for Popular Software must be enabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> EMET >> "Default Protections for Popular Software" to "Enabled".
Note: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.
Due to a change in the registry structure for EMET 5.5, if the system has a previous version of EMET installed and configured, this setting needs to be set to "Not Configured" prior to the upgrade to EMET 5.5, and the new administrative template files copied to the appropriate area. The setting can then be re-enabled.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be enabled and configured to at least Application Opt Out.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> "System DEP" to "Enabled" with at least "Application Opt-Out" selected.
The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.
Document applications that do not function properly due to this setting, and are opted out, with the ISSO.
Opted out exceptions can be configured with the following command: EMET_Conf --Set "application path\executable name" -DEP
Alternately, configure exceptions in System Properties: Select "System" in Control Panel. Select "Advanced system settings". Click "Settings" in the "Performance" section. Select the "Data Execution Prevention" tab. Select "Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select:".
Applications that are opted out are configured in the window below this selection.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be configured to Application Opt Out.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
This is applicable to unclassified systems, for other systems this is NA.
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> EMET -> "System SEHOP" to "Enabled" with "Application Opt-Out" selected.
The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit must be installed on the system and the administrative template files added to make this setting available.
Document applications that do not function properly due to this setting, and are opted out, with the ISSO.
Opted out exceptions can be configured with the following command: EMET_Conf --Set "application path\executable name" -SEHOP

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) v5.5 or later must be installed on the system.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit can enable several mechanisms, such as Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR), and Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) on the system and applications adding additional levels of protection.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Install EMET v5.5 or later on the system. EMET is available for download from Microsoft.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Install the US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificate on unclassified systems.
Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint DoD Root CA 2 - US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA 1 - DA36FAF56B2F6FBA1604F5BE46D864C9FA013BA3
Administrators should run the Federal Bridge Certification Authority (FBCA) Cross-Certificate Removal Tool once as an administrator and once as the current user.
The FBCA Cross-Certificate Remover tool and user guide is available on IASE at http://iase.disa.mil/pki-pke/Pages/tools.aspx.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least OptOut.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Data Execution Prevention (DEP) prevents harmful code from running in protected memory locations reserved for Windows and other programs.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure DEP to at least OptOut.
Open a command prompt (cmd.exe) or PowerShell with elevated privileges (Run as administrator). Enter "BCDEDIT /set {current} nx OptOut". (If using PowerShell "{current}" must be enclosed in quotes.) "AlwaysOn", a more restrictive selection, is also valid but does not allow applications that do not function properly to be opted out of DEP.
Note: Suspend BitLocker before making changes to the DEP configuration.
Opted out exceptions can be configured in the "System Properties".
Open "System" in Control Panel. Select "Advanced system settings". Click "Settings" in the "Performance" section. Select the "Data Execution Prevention" tab. Applications that are opted out are configured in the window below the selection "Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select:".

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be turned on.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) blocks exploits that use the Structured Exception Handling overwrite technique, a common buffer overflow attack.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the following registry value:
Registry Hive: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Registry Path: \SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\kernel\
Value Name: DisableExceptionChainValidation
Value Type: REG_DWORD Value: 0

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".
The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.
This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description:
<VulnDiscussion>SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client (extra setting needed for pre-Win8.1/2012R2)" to "Enabled" with the following three lines of text entered for "Configure LanmanWorkstation Dependencies": Bowser MRxSmb20 NSI
The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

metadata.title: Lockout Duration
metadata.description: Windows 7 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
Verifies 'Account lockout duration' is set to '15 or greater'
'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Attempts
metadata.description: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: Windows 7 must be configured for the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset to 15 minutes or greater.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '15' minutes
'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Maximum Password Age
metadata.description: Maximum password age must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less
Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: The minimum password age must meet requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters

metadata.title: Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
metadata.description: The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Reversible Password Encryption
metadata.description: Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Password Uniqueness
metadata.description: Password uniqueness must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more

metadata.title: UR: Act as part of the operating system
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Act as part of the operating system user right.

criterion.comment: Act as part of the operating system - None

metadata.title: UR: Create permanent shared objects
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create permanent shared objects user right.

criterion.comment: Create permanent shared objects - None

metadata.title: UR: Modify an object label
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Modify an object label user right.

criterion.comment: Modify an object label - None

metadata.title: UR: Lock pages in memory
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Lock pages in memory user right.

criterion.comment: Lock pages in memory - None

metadata.title: UR: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation user right.

criterion.comment: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation - None

metadata.title: UR: Deny log on as a service
metadata.description: The Deny log on as a service user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems. No other groups or accounts must be assigned this right.

extend_definition.comment: Deny log on as a service - Non-Domain Systems
Deny log on as a service - Domain Joined Systems

metadata.title: UR: Create a token object
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create a token object user right.

criterion.comment: Create a token object - None

metadata.title: UR: Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services user right.

criterion.comment: Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services - None

metadata.title: UR: Deny log on as a batch job
metadata.description: The Deny log on as a batch job user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

extend_definition.comment: Deny log on as a batch job - Non-Domain Systems
Deny log on as a batch job - Domain Joined Systems

metadata.title: UR: Deny log on locally
metadata.description: The Deny log on locally user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

extend_definition.comment: Deny log on locally - Non-Domain Systems
Deny log on locally - Domain Joined Systems

metadata.title: UR: Generate security audits
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Generate security audits user right.

criterion.comment: Generate security audits - Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Replace a process level token
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Replace a process level token user right.

criterion.comment: Replace a process level token - Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Debug Programs
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Debug programs user right.

criterion.comment: Debug Programs - None

metadata.title: UR: Deny access to this computer from the network
metadata.description: The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local administrator accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

extend_definition.comment: Deny access to this computer from the network - Non-Domain Systems
Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Joined Systems

metadata.title: Disable Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Guest account status' is set to 'Disabled'
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Administrator Account
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Rename administrator account' is set to a value other than 'Administrator'

metadata.title: Rename Built-in Guest Account
metadata.description: The built-in guest account must be renamed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Rename guest account' is set to a value other than 'Guest'
Verifies built-in guest account does not exist

metadata.title: Audit Access to Global System Objects
metadata.description: Auditing Access of Global System Objects must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Audit: Audit the access of global system objects' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Audit Backup and Restore Privileges
metadata.description: Auditing of Backup and Restore Privileges must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Audit Policy Subcategory Setting
metadata.description: Audit policy using subcategories must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Secure Print Driver Installation
metadata.description: The print driver installation privilege must be restricted to administrators.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Devices: Prevent users from installing printer drivers' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Secure Removable Media - CD-ROM
metadata.description: Access to CD drives must not be limited to users logged on locally.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Devices: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted or signed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Encryption of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)' is set to 'Enabled'
Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be signed when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)' is set to 'Enabled'
Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Computer Account Password Reset
metadata.description: The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Disable machine account password changes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: The maximum age for machine account passwords must be set to requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is set to '30' days or less
Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Strong Session Key
metadata.description: The system must be configured to require a strong session key.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Require strong (Windows 2000 or later) session key' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Display of Last User Name
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent the display of the last username on the logon screen.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Do not display last user name' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Ctrl+Alt+Del Security Attention Sequence
metadata.description: The Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence for logons must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials
metadata.description: Caching of logon credentials must be limited.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive Logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)' is set to '2' logons or less
System is not a member of a domain

metadata.title: Password Expiration Warning
metadata.description: Users must be warned in advance of their passwords expiring.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration' is set for '14' days or more

metadata.title: Domain Controller authentication for unlock
metadata.description: Domain Controller authentication must not be required to unlock the workstation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Require Domain Controller authentication to unlock workstation' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Smart Card Removal Option
metadata.description: The Smart Card removal option must be configured to Force Logoff or Lock Workstation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Lock Workstation'
Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Force Logoff'

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Network Client: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (if server agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client must be enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server
metadata.description: Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to a third-party SMB Server.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Network Client: Send unencrypted password to connect to third-party SMB servers' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.
metadata.description: The amount of idle time required before suspending a session must be properly set.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session' is set to '15' minutes or less

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (if client agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server must perform SMB packet signing when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Network Server: Digitally sign communications (if Client agrees)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Users must be forcibly disconnected when their logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous Network Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Storage of Passwords and Credentials
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent the storage of passwords and credentials.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow storage of credentials or .NET Passports for network authentication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Everyone Anonymous Rights
metadata.description: The system must not be configured to give anonymous users Everyone rights.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes
metadata.description: Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously' is configured to contain no values

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths
metadata.description: Unauthorized registry paths must not be remotely accessible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths' is configured to contain authorized registry paths

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths and Sub-Paths
metadata.description: Unauthorized remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths must not be configured.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub paths' is configured to contain authorized registry paths

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Network Shares
metadata.description: Unauthorized shares must not be accessed anonymously.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously' is blank
Verifies 'Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously' is not configured

metadata.title: Sharing and Security Model for Local Accounts
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use the Classic security model.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts' is set to 'Classic - local users authenticate as themselves'

metadata.title: LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Force Logoff When Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: The system must be configured to force users to log off when their allowed logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: LanMan Authentication Level
metadata.description: The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5)

metadata.title: LDAP Client Signing
metadata.description: Network Security: LDAP client signing requirements

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: LDAP client signing requirements' is set to at a minimum 'Negotiate signing'

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Servers
metadata.description: The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based servers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security'
Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption'

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based clients.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security
Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption

metadata.title: Display Shutdown Button
metadata.description: The shutdown option must be available from the logon dialog box.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Shutdown: Allow system to be shutdown without having to log on' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Clear System Pagefile
metadata.description: System pagefile must not be cleared upon shutdown

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: FIPS Compliant Algorithms
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Case Insensitivity for Non-Windows
metadata.description: The system must be configured to require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System objects: Require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Global System Objects Permission Strength
metadata.description: The default permissions of global system objects must be increased.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Elevation Prompt
metadata.description: User Account Control must, at minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for consent on the secure desktop'
Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop'

metadata.title: UAC - User Elevation Prompt
metadata.description: User Account Control must, at minimum, prompt users for credentials on the secure desktop.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users' is set to 'Automatically deny elevation requests'

metadata.title: UAC - Application Installations
metadata.description: User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Application Elevations
metadata.description: Windows must elevate all applications in User Account Control, not just signed ones.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Only elevate executables that are signed and validated' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: UAC - UIAccess Application Elevation
metadata.description: User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - All Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Secure Desktop Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control must switch to the secure desktop when prompting for elevation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Switch to the secure desktop when prompting for elevation' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization
metadata.description: User Account Control must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Built-in Admin Account Status
metadata.description: The built-in administrator account must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Administrator account status' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Removable media devices - Floppies
metadata.description: Access to floppy drives must not be limited to users logged on locally.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Devices: Restrict floppy access to locally logged-on user only' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Disable Automatic Logon
metadata.description: Automatic logons must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifes 'MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)' is set to 'Disabled'
Verifies the automatic logon password registry value (DefaultPassword) does not exist

metadata.title: Disable IP Source Routing
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent IP source routing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Disable ICMP Redirect
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent ICMP redirects from overriding OSPF generated routes.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: TCP Connection Keep-Alive Time
metadata.description: The system must be configured to limit how often keep-alive packets are sent.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (KeepAliveTime) How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds' is set to '300000 or 5 minutes (recommended)' or less

metadata.title: Disable Router Discovery
metadata.description: The system must be configured to disable the Internet Router Discovery Protocol (IRDP).

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (PerformRouterDiscovery) Allow IRDP to detect and configure Default Gateway addresses (could lead to DoS)' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Safe DLL Search Mode
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use Safe DLL Search Mode.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (SafeDllSearchMode) Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period
metadata.description: The system must be configured to have password protection take effect within a limited time frame when the screen saver becomes active.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (ScreenSaverGracePeriod) The time in seconds before the screen saver grace period expires (0 recommended)' is set to 5 or less

metadata.title: TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: The system must limit how many times unacknowledged TCP data is retransmitted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is the default)' is set to 3 or less

metadata.title: Audit Log Warning Level
metadata.description: The system must generate an audit event when the audit log reaches a percentage of full threshold.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (WarningLevel) Percentage threshold for the security event log at which the system will generate a warning' is set to 90 percent or less

metadata.title: SPN Target Name Validation Level
metadata.description: The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level must be configured to Accept if provided by client.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Server SPN target name validation level' is set to 'Accept if provided by client'

metadata.title: IPv6 Source Routing
metadata.description: IPv6 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Hide Computer
metadata.description: The system must be configured to hide the computer from the browse list.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (Hidden) Hide computer from the browse list (Not Recommended except for highly secure environments' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: IPv6 TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: IPv6 TCP data retransmissions must be configured to prevent resources from becoming exhausted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions IPv6) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is the default)' is set to 3 or less

metadata.title: Computer Identity Authentication for NTLM
metadata.description: Services using Local System that use negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow Local System to use computer identity for NTLM' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: NTLM NULL Session Fallback
metadata.description: NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: PKU2U Online Identities Authentication
metadata.description: PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Kerberos Encryption Types (Windows 7)
metadata.description: The use of DES encryption suites must not be allowed for Kerberos encryption.

extend_definition.comment: A minimum encryption type is configured for Kerberos encryption excluding DES encryption suites

metadata.title: Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success only
Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Security Group Management - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Security Group Management - Success only
Audit - Security Group Management - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Security State Change - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit System - Security State Change successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Security State Change - Success only
Audit - Security State Change - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Security System Extension - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Security System Extension - Success only
Audit - Security System Extension - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Sensitive Privilege Use - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Sensitive Privilege Use - Success only
Audit - Sensitive Privilege Use - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - System Integrity - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - System Integrity - Success only
Audit - System Integrity - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - User Account Management - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - User Account Management - Success only
Audit - User Account Management - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success only
Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Computer Account Management - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Computer Account Management successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Computer Account Management - Success only
Audit - Computer Account Management - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Credential Validation - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - Credential Validation - Success only
Audit - Credential Validation - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - IPSec Driver - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit System - IPsec Driver successes.

criterion.comment: Audit - IPSec Driver - Success only
Audit - IPSec Driver - Success and Failure

metadata.title: Audit - Logon - Success
metadata.description: The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon successes.
